sn2.28:1.1: Standing to one side, the god Nandivisāla addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn2.28:2.1: “Four are its wheels, and nine its doors;
sn2.28:2.2: it’s filled with greed and tied up;
sn2.28:2.3: and it’s born from a bog. Great hero,
sn2.28:2.4: how am I supposed to live like this?”
sn2.28:3.3: and having plucked out craving, root and all:
sn2.28:3.4: that’s how you’re supposed to live like this.”
